sen.j: 清原 宣賢（きよはら のぶかた、文明 (日本)7年（1475年） － 天文 (元号)19年7月12日 (旧暦)（1550年8月24日））は、室町時代・戦国時代 (日本)の公卿・学者。
sen.e: Nobukata KIYOHARA [1475 - July 12, 1550 on lunar calendar (August 24, 1550)] was a Kugyo (the top court officials) and scholar in Muromachi and Sengoku era.
Nobukata KIYOHARA [1475 - July 12, 1550 on lunar calendar (August 24, 1550)] was a Kugyo (the top court official) and a scholar during the Muromachi and Sengoku eras.

sen.j: 吉田神社詞官神道家吉田兼倶の3男だった。
sen.e: He was the third son of Kanetomo YOSHIDA who was Shintoist and a Haikan (priest) of Yoshida-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 宣賢は宮中に仕えて講義を行い、明経道を整理して多くの国学儒学の論文著作をおこなった。
sen.e: Nobukata served in the imperial court and gave lectures, also studied Myogyodo (one of the Confucian schools) and wrote lucubration and literary works about Kokugaku and Jugaku (native studies and Confucianism).

sen.e: In 1529, he retired from the service of the court and shaved his head and became a bonze to devote his life to study naming himself Kansuiken Sobu as byname.
